intro: Stachys recta subsp. hirta, commonly known as hairy betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces spikes of violet to blue flowers, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks.
